resources.Name: English
resources.Author: FlylinkDC++ Development Team
resources.string:
ADLSearch is a tool for fast searching of directory listings downloaded from users. 
Create a new ADLSearch entering 'avi' as search string for example. When you download a directory listing from a user, all AVI-files will be placed in a special folder called <<<ADLSearch>>> for easy finding. It is almost the same as using the standard 'Find' multiple times in a directory listing. 
 
Special options: 
- 'Active' check box selects if the search is used or not. 
- 'Source Type' can be the following options; 'Filename' matches search against filename, 'Directory' matches against current subdirectory and places the whole structure in the special folder, 'Full Path' matches against whole directory + filename. 
- 'Destination Directory' selects the special output folder for a search. Multiple folders with different names can exist simultaneously. 
- 'Min/Max Size' sets file size limits. This is not used for 'Directory' type searches. 
- 'Move Up'/'Move Down' can be used to organize the list of searches. 
 
There is a new option in the context menu (right-click) for directory listings. It is called 'Go to directory' and can be used to jump to the original location of the file or directory. 
 
Extra features: 
 
1) If you use %y.%m.%d in a search string it will be replaced by today's date. Switch place on y/m/d, or leave any of them out to alter the substitution. If you use %[nick] it will be replaced by the nick of the user you download the directory listing from. 
 
2) If you name a destination directory 'discard', it will not be shown in the total result. 
Useful with the extra feature 3) below to remove uninteresting results. 
 
3) There is a switch called 'Break on first ADLSearch match' in Settings->Advanced'. 
If enabled, ADLSearch will stop after the first match for a specific file/directory. 
The order in the ADLSearch windows is therefore important. Example: Add a search item at the top of the list with string='xxx' and destination='discard'. It will catch many pornographic files and they will not be included in any following search results.

Command Types: 
Separator: Adds a separator to the menu 
Raw: Sends raw command to the hub (experts only, end it with '|'!) 
Chat: Sends command as if you were typing it in the chat 
PM: Sends command as if you sent it by PM 
Contexts determine where the command is shown: 
Hub Menu: Hub tab (at the bottom of the screen) right-click menu 
Chat Menu: User right-click menu in chat and PM tab menu 
Search Menu: Search right-click menu 
Parameters: 
Name: Name (use '' to create submenus) 
Command: Command text (may contain parameters) 
Hub: Hub IP as typed when connecting (empty = all hubs, "op" = hubs where you're op) 
To: PM recipient 
Only once: Send only once per user from search frame 
In the parameters, you can use %[xxx] variables and date/time specifiers (%Y, %m, â€¦). The following are available: 
%[myNI]: your own nick 
%[userNI]: the user's nick (user && search context only) 
%[userTAG]: user tag (user && search context only) 
%[userDE]: user description (user && search con4text only) 
%[userEM]: user email (user && search context only) 
%[userSS]: user shared bytes (exact) (user && search context only) 
%[userSSshort]: user shared bytes (formatted) (user && search context only) 
%[userI4]: user IP (if supported by hub) 
%[fileFN]: filename (search context only) 
%[line:reason]: opens up a window asking for "reason"

Opening the window \"Internet Hubs\" you should be aware that their visit will lead to an external (Internet) traffic. If you fare with a limited amount of incoming traffic, visits to these hubs can lead to down speed to external resources because of threshold excess or to a substantial increase in bills for the Internet. \n \nShow the list of hubs?

/itunes - For iTunes media spamming 
- %[version] - version (ex: 10.0.1.22) 
- %[album] - name of the album the current track is from 
- %[artist] - artist of the current track 
- %[title] - name of the currently playing track 
- %[genre] - genre of the currently playing track 
- %[elapsed] - time elapsed in minutes:seconds 
- %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length 
- %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) 
- %[length] - total length of the current track 
- %[bitrate] - bitrate for the playing track (kbps) 
- %[frequency] - frequency for the currently playing track (kHz) 
- %[year] - year of publication/recording of the current track 
- %[size] - size of the currently playing file 
- %[state] - current state of iTunes (playing/stopped) 
 
Empty = Default String -> +me listens %[artist] - %[title] â€¢ listened to %[percent] (%[length], %[bitrate], iTunes %[version])
You have no media playing in iTunes
Supported version of iTunes is not running

/ja - For JetAudio spamming 
 
- %[filepath] - name of the file currently playing 
- %[title] - name of the currently playing item (without file extension) 
- %[artist] - artist 
- %[state] - current state of JetAudio (playing/paused/stopped) 
- %[elapsed] - time elapsed in minutes:seconds 
- %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length 
- %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) 
- %[length] - total length of the current file 
- %[version] - Version on JetAudio 
- %[magnet] - magnet to current file (if not shared - show only filename ) 
 
Empty = Default String -> +me listens %[artist] - %[title] * listened to %[percent], JetAudio %[version]

- %[title] - name of the currently playing item (without file extension) 
- %[size] - size of the file currently playing 
- %[state] - current state of Media Player Classic (playing/paused/stopped) 
- %[elapsed] - time elapsed in minutes:seconds 
- %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length 
- %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) 
- %[length] - total length of the current file

This version released or there is a newer version

- %a - Abbreviated weekday name 
- %A - Full weekday name 
- %b - Abbreviated month name 
- %B - Full month name 
- %c - Date and time representation appropriate for locale 
- %d - Day of month as decimal number (01 â€“ 31) 
- %H - Hour in 24-hour format (00 â€“ 23) 
- %I - Hour in 12-hour format (01 â€“ 12) 
- %j - Day of year as decimal number (001 â€“ 366) 
- %m - Month as decimal number (01 â€“ 12) 
- %M - Minute as decimal number (00 â€“ 59) 
- %p - Current locale's A.M./P.M. indicator for 12-hour clock 
- %S - Second as decimal number (00 â€“ 59) 
- %U - Week of year as decimal number, with Sunday as first day of week (00 â€“ 53) 
- %w - Weekday as decimal number (0 â€“ 6; Sunday is 0) 
- %W - Week of year as decimal number, with Monday as first day of week (00 â€“ 53) 
- %x - Date representation for current locale 
- %X - Time representation for current locale 
- %y - Year without century, as decimal number (00 â€“ 99) 
- %Y - Year with century, as decimal number 
- %z, %Z - Either the time-zone name or time zone abbreviation, depending on registry settings; no characters if time zone is unknown 
- %% - Percent sign 
 
Default: %H:%M:%S

Your version of windows common controls is too old for FlylinkDC++ to run correctly, and you will most probably experience problems with the user interface. You should download version 5.80 or higher from the DC++ homepage or from Microsoft directly.

This feature is only available to power user! ;)

/winamp - Works with Winamp 1.x, 2.x, 5.x (no Winamp 3 support) 
 
- %[version] - version (ex: 5.58) 
- %[state] - playing state (ex: stopped/paused/playing) 
- %[title] - window title from Winamp. If you want to change this for mp3s, Winamp > Pref > Input > MPEG > Title 
- %[rawtitle] - window title from Winamp (if %[title] not working properly) 
- %[percent] - percentage (ex. 40%) 
- %[length] - length (ex: 09:00) 
- %[elapsed] - time elapsed (ex. 07:51) 
- %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) 
- %[bitrate] - bitrate (ex. 707kbps) 
- %[sample] - sample frequency (ex. 44kHz) 
- %[channels] - number of channels (ex. stereo / mono) 
 
- %[magnet] - magnet to current file (if not shared - show only filename ) 
 
Empty = Default String: 
+me listen: %[artist] - %[elapsed] %[track] - %[title] â€¢ listened to %[percent] (%[length], %[bitrate], Winamp %[version]) 
 
Note about The KMPlayer: 
You can use most of the features offered by /winamp command and all features of the media toolbar also with The KMPlayer. 
Parameters that are known not to work (or return incorrect values) are %[version], %[bitrate], %[sample] and %[channels]. 
It's also very likely that you will need to use %[rawtitle] instead of %[title] to get the correct output.
Supported version of Winamp is not running
Post media spam to main chat

/wmp - Works with Windows Media Player 9+ 
- %[version] - version of Windows Media Player 
- %[fullversion] - full version of Windows Media Player 
- %[status] - pre-formatted status string from Windows Media Player 
- %[title] - name of the currently playing item 
- %[elapsed] - time elapsed in (HH:)MM:SS 
- %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length 
- %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) 
- %[length] - full length of the current item in (HH:)MM:SS 
- %[artist] - name of the artist for the currently playing item 
- %[album] - name of the album the current song is from 
- %[genre] - genre of the current media 
- %[bitrate] - bitrate for the playing media 
- %[year] - year of album publication (no WMP9 support) 
- %[size] - size of the currently playing file 
- %[rating] - users rating, represented with *'s (if available) 
 
Empty = Default String -> +me %[title] at %[bitrate] <Windows Media Player %[version]>

This Wizard can help you to setup FlylinkDC++ client: 
 1. Default Nick 
 2. Download and Temp folders 
 3. Share your files to allow DC++ users to download them 
 4. Setup your network configuration 
 5. Add favorite hubs
Setup your default NICK for DC++ hubs (maximum 64 symbols):
It is recommended to use following symbols in your Nick:
Help: Use non-system folders on drive with more than 10 Gb free space (recommended)â€¦
Setup your default E-Mail for DC++ hubs (optional)
Setup your default description for DC++ hubs (optional)
Now you can start using FlylinkDC++!

You can add folders which will be shared with other users. All subfolders and files in selected folders can be downloaded by users from connected hubs. \nDo not share folders with system files, please!

This page will help you to setup IP for FlylinkDC++
Your default IP adress for connections to hubs
Automatically update IP on each application start
This page will help you to setup network for FlylinkDC++
Set random ports on each start
If you have other setuped firewall or antivirus with firewall on your system, you should enable FlylinkDC++ application network operations in it.
Router/ADSL Modem (this section only if you have such device)
If you have router or ADSL modem connected to network, you should setup it for FlylinkDC++. You must setup UPNP enabled on it, or make port forwarding.
